summary.p: Will always support those recommended by Bullinger, but asks not to be angry if he writes rarely due to being overwhelmed. Greetings.

div.p: Greetings. My venerable Bullinger, dearest brother, I will always perform my duty towards all those whom you commend to me, provided that I may obtain this one thing from you: that you do not become angry because I very rarely write anything to you; for I am torn apart by countless (unzählige) affairs, so that I can do nothing for friends. Perhaps soon, a little more leisure will shine upon me.
Farewell well and commend me, as you do, to Christ. Greet Pellican, Theodor, Leo, and all the others.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, Bishop of the people of Zurich, lord and brother much to be revered in Christ.
